Class Score

  • java.lang.Object
    • Score

  • public class Score
extends java.lang.Object
    This program represents the score card for the game of Rainbow Yahtzee. CPSC 224-01, Spring 2020 Programming Assignment Project sources to cite:
    Author:
    Nicole, Kevin, Eric, Jackson

      • Score

        public Score(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> hand,

        EVC that creates a variable of the dice in hand
        Parameters:
        hand - represents the dice faces rolled in hand
        diceInPlay - the number of dice in play

    • Method Detail

      • createLinesOfScorecard

        public void createLinesOfScorecard()
        creates the lines column of the scorecard

      • reset

        public void reset()
        resets values

      • createScorecard

        public void createScorecard(int player_num)
        this function overwrites any existing scorecard.txt file with a file ready to start a new game
        Parameters:
        player_num - the number of players in the game

      • readScorecard

        public void readScorecard(int player_num)
        this function reads the scorecard.txt file stores score values in in a list named scorecardScoreList that aligns with scorecardLineList
        Parameters:
        player_num - the number of players in the game

      • writeScorecard

        public void writeScorecard(java.lang.String lineCode,
                           int player_num)
        this function overwrites any existing scorecard.txt file with the contents of the scorecardList
        Parameters:
        lineCode - is the code value for the line column in which the user wants to choose for the scorecard
        player_num - the number of players in the game

      • displayScoreCard

        public java.lang.String displayScoreCard()
        this function returns a string rep a scorecard from the scorecardList
        Returns:
        scorecard

      • displayScoreOptions

        public java.lang.String displayScoreOptions()
        displays scorecard options for user to choose from based on the hand that the user has
        Returns:
        upperScoreCard(dice_in_play) + lowerScoreCard()

      • calculateRunningScores

        public void calculateRunningScores()
        calculates the running scores for the score card

      • upperScoreCard

        private java.lang.String upperScoreCard(int dice_in_play)
        represents the upper score card of the game Yahtzee
        Parameters:
        dice_in_play - the number of dice in play
        Returns:
        a String of the upperScoreCard possible options

      • lowerScoreCard

        private java.lang.String lowerScoreCard()
        represents the lower score card of the game Yahtzee
        Returns:
        a String of the lowerScoreCard possible options

      • totalAllDice

        private int totalAllDice()
        totals the dice in the hand
        Returns:
        the total of dice in hand

      • maxOfAKindFound

        private int maxOfAKindFound()
        determines the max number of a kind is found in a hand
        Returns:
        maxCount - the maximum number of repeated numbers in hand

      • primaryFound

        private boolean primaryFound()
        determines if there is a primary in the hand
        Returns:
        true if primary (yellow, red, and blue) (dice 3,1,5) present, false otherwise

      • secondaryFound

        private boolean secondaryFound()
        determines if there is a secondary in the hand
        Returns:
        true if secondary (green, orange, and violet) (dice 4,2,7) present, false otherwise

      • warmPalletFound

        private boolean warmPalletFound()
        determines if there is a warm pallet in the hand
        Returns:
        true if secondary (red, orange, and yellow) (dice 1,2,3) present, false otherwise

      • coldPalletFound

        private boolean coldPalletFound()
        determines if there is a cold pallet in the hand
        Returns:
        true if cold pallet (green, blue, indigo, and violet) present, false otherwise

      • rainbowFound

        private boolean rainbowFound()
        determines if there is a rainbow in the hand
        Returns:
        true if rainbow present, false otherwise

      • getScorecardLineList

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getScorecardLineList()
        retrieves scorecardLineList
        Returns:
        scorecardLineList which is the running list of the scorecard line
